Really great app for tracking expenses and income. The gamification is lovely and the software runs smoothly with a user-friendly design. My one criticism is that some of the things that do help gamify the experience also have distracting elements. It would be better if they wouldn't try to keep people occupied as it might put some people off if it ends up taking too much of their time. Having said that, it is a very charming app and there is no inconvenience in using the free version.

Okay folks, I've been using this game tracker for well over a year consistently, here are my thoughts: It's great and simple. Very convenient! However, you need this mindset for it to help you: you are NOT trying to grow your city. You are using your city to accurately reflect your expenses. If you try to just grow your city, you'll spend more, which is silly. I love seeing the breakdown of my expenses, and this gives a clean and categorized way of doing it. It is also very aesthetic!

整體用起來很不錯！！少一顆星是因為還有很多進步空間，例如：1.縮放（無法放到最大觀看整個城市面貌）2.鑽石及金幣的消耗過於龐大，經常升級一兩次，就要再存個幾天，一天含廣告頂多20顆多 3.任務的收穫太低了吧....等幾個小時，得到的只有$100？！1~2顆鑽石？建議要隨著消耗的等級提升，不然到後面我升級一次要幾十萬金幣、幾10顆鑽石，只給我100有何用 4.廣告鑽石經常處於沒有的狀態，等了半天還是告訴我沒廣告可以看......以上是一些小建議，應該很多人有跟我一樣的問題，然而我知道開發APP很辛苦，所以辛苦你們了~~~加油，希望能越做越好~~~

Minor bug: Regular expenses on the 31st of every month don't trigger on months with only 30 days (or less, like February). Similarly, regular expenses on the 29th or 30th don't trigger in February. This is different from what monthly subscriptions (e.g., Netflix) in real life actually do. Fun method to gamify my expenses so I have actually tracked them for 3+ years. Lets me categorize my expenses (39 categories max), as well as the payment type (e.g., which credit card), which can be filtered while using the built-in search. Tracks regular expenses but only those every week or every month - I wish it could track more (like every year, every 6 months). After awhile, you need to spend real-world money or watch ads to earn diamonds to unlock some achievements (e.g., specific buildings, vehicles, VIP citizens) or themes. If you don't care about that, using the app without frills is free.

This app is great, I love the cute icons and colourful interface! But overtime some features (or lack of features) reduces my rating. The recurring transactions are not automatically added in. If you forgot to enter the app that day, the option to add that transction will disappear (and you have to key the whole transaction in again which beats the point of auto). It's great that the app gives 5 free parks everytime you enter (if you don't hit the max daily building), but we can only delete it one by one and there's no option to remove this free park feature. This overall starts to slow down the app startup when there's too much buildings A good feature to add in is to total the income and expenses up-till-date. It's a hassle to still have to go thru monthly and add up my savings to figure out my total savings. It's gonna be a problem when there's many many months Overall I like this app but if these features are not improved I'll have to find a better expense tracker app

Fortune City is a great way to take the boring out if budgeting. The window for a button to register a tap is extremely small and there isn't much functionality for zooming out. It's getting five stars but there's a lot of room for improvement. For starters, the app introduction is incomplete. When I first used the app, I had no idea if the bar graphs in each character page was how much that person liked that field, or the ratio of different fields that the city needs to have before the visitor wants to be a citizen. I still have no idea what the benefit of having VIP Citizens or more taxis is. If there could be a more in depth tutorial, that would be great! The amount of citizens allowed in the city should be MUCH more to accommodate the amount of growth of the city. Also, on a regular basis the game needs to show how many more buildings I need before my population count will go up. Maybe tapping the citizen count will bring up an interface that shows how many more buildings are needed. Moreover, the initial amount of builders available is too little for the amount of transactions I input in a day. Can there please be more space for adding citizens and more initial builders? I love how slowly but surely you can build gem count. It's Chibi style is so pleasing to look at and I'm glad it's a game that's useful in my everyday life. Hopefully, you all will be very successful with your ideas. Thank you for making this app, I greatly appreciate it! Strongly Recommend.

This is a nice app for financial self-accountability. There's no linking to 
accounts. The plus of that is more mindful entries and no privacy worries. 
It is less automated than non-gamified accounting apps, but I think that's 
part of the draw of the mindfulness part (for me at least). I only wish the 
social aspect was more involved! You can have friends in the app, but you 
only see each other's cities. There doesn't appear to be any way to help 
your friends or otherwise communicate within the app. A community, kind of 
like the labs in Walkr (another Fourdesire app) would be nice. Disclaimer - 
I paid early on not to see ads except for those to earn daily diamonds. I 
forget how common they were offhand without that.

to make it easier, not more difficult.

This is an absolutely fantastic app.  The characters are absolutely adorable, and the cat is to die for. The graphics of this app is absolutely excellent, and everything looks beautiful. The entry system is really well planned and thought out, and I love the way the stats and graphs are organised, and the entries look great.  A few concerns though. People might start faking entries and deleting them to gain the buildings they want. If I can think of this in a few days after installing the app, surely so can others. I suggest deleting the relevant building when the entry gets deleted too.  Another concern is that the entries are organised by the time they were written. I sometimes forget to write the entries at the correct time, so the order of my entries gets messed up. I think it would be fantastic if you could add in an edit timestamp and order option, since that would improve the organisation. Also, many other people have suggested a savings option, which would be really useful.  And it really makes me want to spend as much as I can!  Much thanks to the developers for creating such a beautifully designed and useful app.

While I enjoy the concept of building a city and getting it to prosper the fact that I can only do so by recording daily spending doesn't help me to budget. I can go days without spending but this app makes me want to make purchases daily to grow my city.   More focus needs to be placed on saving money. A reward system for saving money. Perhaps something like if you record saving X amount you get to use a virtual equivalent of that to pay for buildings/cars etc in your city to build it up. As well as setting a budget for yourself weekly + monthly and city rewards for sticking to that budget. Ex. "How much do you wish to spend monthly for fun? How much do you need for necessities (rent, food, bills)? How much do you wish to save?"   At this point I am still deciding if I will keep using this app. I enjoy the UI/look of tracking and comparing my expenses but the game part makes it tempting to keep buying to add to my city.

Amazing app. Reminds me of 2048, tiny towers, animal crossing, all the while helping you visually see where your money is going.  It's my favorite app on the app store currently and I HIGHLY recommend downloading it. It's really polished and has made me a lot more conscious about my spending, but in a healthy way that doesn't make me feel bad. Recording expenses as a habit doesn't feel like a chore, but rather, a fun daily thing you get to do to help grow a town.  I also love Cashy!! Great job to the designer/animator. I really feel much better and happier when I click on him and I wish he had more phrases. He's so cute.  Phenomenal app, Four Desire. I liked Walkr back a few years ago but it grew tedious over time. Fortune City really shines as a fun and addicting game that promote healthy expense-recording behavior, which I've always admired about this company. Interesting way to track your expenses. I say interesting, cute even, but not exactly fun. Mainly because I have a few issues with it. This app creates a building each time you track a real world expense based on the type of expense it is. So, if I go eat out a lot, but the end of the month I should have a pretty high level restaurant. The problem is, this app tends to make me WANT to spend money in order to build out my town more. Shouldn't I get rewarded for the amount I'm saving rather than how much I'm spending? Seems a little counterintuitive. Since I'm trying to not spend any money, I usually spend the day staring at the same ol' buildings with the little townspeople occasionally asking me to find their car keys for them or some other "find this" request.  Seriously though, I like the intention of this app.   Edit: Raised to 4 stars because I found how to add recurring payment reminders so that it automatically places it on your payments for the day you assigned it to and allowed you to check it off when it'd been paid. That will be useful for me and makes this app a little more usable. However for it to be really usable, I'll probably have to modify the dates a little because I want it to tell me in advance what I'm looking at fiscally for the month... If that makes sense. Also, it doesn't sync to my account stand allow me to pay from the app which is an inconvenience that's not really worth using the app for.

It's cute and easy to use, and that's enough to motivate me to record my spendings regularly. Something I'd like to commend in particular is how easy it is to earn in-game currency. There's both automatically generated currency (coins) for every function, and premium currency (diamonds) for town themes and other special features. The app gives you like 2-3 chances to earn diamonds every day, and that makes it even more motivating to go back to the app frequently. It would be nice though if I could completely opt out of the daily notifications, and if there was a feature that would show me my current total balance, not just a summary of my spendings. This app is cute and it's good for tracking cash outflow and showing your spending habits, but it's not for serious budgeting.

This app is helpful for tracking your purchases, which is great.  I've seen a lot of people complain that you can't build more buildings in a single day, but... That's kind of the point? Like, you shouldn't be trying to make a city that has five new buildings everyday, because then you're making at least 5 unique purchases. Which isn't how you live on a budget. I do wish there were better categories for things. There's no "groceries" option. Which is strange since it seems like I go to the grocery store nearly everyday. And I hardly ever buy purses or hats.And there's no category for Bills. Like, I have a credit card and it's in the same category as my groceries?  This is a nice app, but it seems to focus a lot on luxury items and not so much on daily necessities.

But there's still improvements to be made, it would be helpful to have a budget feature that allows you to set an amount and tracks how much you spend for certain categories of items over a period of time, for example, a day, week, month etc. It would also be helpful to allow users to be able to set what type of format they'd like their analytics to be, for example, they may want to view it on a weekly format rather than monthly. It would also be helpful if you could see your total income or loss balance to see the overall amount of money left or spent rather than just show the sum of incomes and losses for the month. The graphs are really useful aids though and the interface was designed really well.

It's a neat and original idea, but this is a bare bones city builder game with a TERRIBLE and even more bare bones finance app. If you want to play a city builder there are far better options. Unless you are a kid this app will in no way help you with any of your finances. Tracking your use of your money can be very useful, but if your only doing it to get virtual buildings and you don't understand what to do with the info it won't help you. I use Expense IQ and its easy to input data but it also allows for customization (ie categories) so I can make things specific to how I use my money and it has far better statistics to help me understand it all. Please make a full fledged finance app for adults (the function) with a city that grows automatically as I input data and reach financial goals (saving, staying within budget) that acts as a cool aesthetic. App looks great but all of its functions are done much better by other apps and the way the app combines those functions is pointless, not fun, and not helpful to my life. I can't justify the time spent using my regular finance app which is very useful and then the time entering a lot of the same data in this app just to build a city. Untill you make this a real finance app the rest seems pointless. However this app seems FANTASTIC for kids as their finances are very basic like the app.
